str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A tree. Probably from drus; a tree.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cut out (off, away), remove, prevent. From ek and kopto; to exscind; figuratively, to frustrate.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
